titles: Ill newes from New-England, or, A nar[r]ative of New-Englands persecution wherin is declared that while old England is becoming new, New-England is become old : also four proposals to the Honoured Parliament and Councel of State, touching the way to propagate the Gospel of Christ ... : also four conclusions touching the faith and order of the Gospel of Christ out of his last will and testament, confirmed and justified / by John Clark ...
author: Clarke, John, 1609-1676.
notes: "A faithfull and true relation of the prosecution of Obediah Holmes, John Crandall, and John Clarke, meerly for conscience towards God, by the principall members of the church, or common-wealth of the Mathatusets in New-England ... drawn forth by the aforesaid John Clarke": p. 1-35.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
